verses.verse: Then the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> again <WH3254> did <WH6213> evil <WH7451> in the sight <WH5869> of the Lord, <WH3068> after Ehud <WH164> died. <WH4191>

And the Lord <WH3068> sold <WH4376> them into the hand <WH3027> of Jabin <WH2985> king <WH4428> of Canaan, <WH3667> who <WH834> reigned <WH4427> in Hazor; <WH2674> and the commander <WH8269> of his army <WH6635> was Sisera, <WH5516> who <WH1931> lived <WH3427> in Harosheth-hagoyim.

And the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> cried <WH6817> to the Lord; <WH3068> for he had nine <WH8672> hundred <WH3967> iron <WH1270> chariots, <WH7393> and he oppressed <WH3905> the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> severely <WH2394> for twenty <WH6242> years. <WH8141>
Now Deborah, <WH1683> a prophetess, <WH5031> the wife <WH802> of Lappidoth, <WH3941> was judging <WH8199> Israel <WH3478> at that time. <WH6256>

And she used to sit <WH3427> under <WH8478> the palm <WH8560> tree <WH8560> of Deborah <WH1683> between <WH996> Ramah <WH7414> and Bethel <WH1008> in the hill <WH2022> country <WH2022> of Ephraim; <WH669> and the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> came <WH5927> up to her for judgment. <WH4941>

Now she sent <WH7971> and summoned <WH7121> Barak <WH1301> the son <WH1121> of Abinoam <WH42> from Kedesh-naphtali, <WH5321> and said <WH559> to him, "Behold, <WH3808> the Lord, <WH3068> the God <WH430> of Israel, <WH3478> has commanded, <WH6680> 'Go <WH1980> and march <WH4900> to Mount <WH2022> Tabor, <WH8396> and take <WH3947> with you ten <WH6235> thousand <WH505> men <WH376> from the sons <WH1121> of Naphtali and from the sons <WH1121> of Zebulun. <WH2074>

'And I will draw <WH4900> out to you Sisera, <WH5516> the commander <WH8269> of Jabin's army, <WH6635> with his chariots <WH7393> and his many <WH1995> [troops] to the river <WH5158> Kishon; <WH7028> and I will give <WH5414> him into your hand. <WH3027>' "
Then Barak <WH1301> said <WH559> to her, "If <WH518> you will go <WH1980> with me, then I will go; <WH1980> but if <WH518> you will not go <WH1980> with me, I will not go. <WH1980>"

And she said, <WH559> "I will surely <WH1980> go <WH1980> with you; nevertheless, <WH657> <WH3588> the honor <WH8597> shall not be yours on the journey <WH1870> that you are about to take, <WH1980> for the Lord <WH3068> will sell <WH4376> Sisera <WH5516> into the hands <WH3027> of a woman. <WH802>" Then Deborah <WH1683> arose <WH6965> and went <WH1980> with Barak <WH1301> to Kedesh. <WH6943>

And Barak <WH1301> called <WH2199> Zebulun <WH2074> and Naphtali <WH5321> together <WH2199> to Kedesh, <WH6943> and ten <WH6235> thousand <WH505> men <WH376> went <WH5927> up with him; Deborah <WH1683> also went <WH5927> up with him.

Now Heber <WH2268> the Kenite <WH7017> had separated <WH6504> himself from the Kenites, <WH9515> from the sons <WH1121> of Hobab <WH2246> the father-in-law of Moses, <WH4872> and had pitched <WH5186> his tent <WH168> as far <WH5704> away as the oak <WH436> in Zaanannim, <WH6815> which <WH834> is near <WH854> Kedesh. <WH6943>
Then they told <WH5046> Sisera <WH5516> that Barak <WH1301> the son <WH1121> of Abinoam <WH42> had gone <WH5927> up to Mount <WH2022> Tabor. <WH8396>

And Sisera <WH5516> called <WH2199> together <WH2199> all <WH3605> his chariots, <WH7393> nine <WH8672> hundred <WH3967> iron <WH1270> chariots, <WH7393> and all <WH3605> the people <WH5971> who <WH834> [were] with him, from Harosheth-hagoyim to the river <WH5158> Kishon. <WH7028>

And Deborah <WH1683> said <WH559> to Barak, <WH1301> "Arise! <WH6965> For this <WH2088> is the day <WH3117> in which <WH834> the Lord <WH3068> has given <WH5414> Sisera <WH5516> into your hands; <WH3027> behold, <WH3808> the Lord <WH3068> has gone <WH3318> out before <WH6440> you." So Barak <WH1301> went <WH3381> down <WH3381> from Mount <WH2022> Tabor <WH8396> with ten <WH6235> thousand <WH505> men <WH376> following <WH310> him.

And the Lord <WH3068> routed <WH2000> Sisera <WH5516> and all <WH3605> [his] chariots <WH7393> and all <WH3605> [his] army, <WH4264> with the edge <WH6310> of the sword <WH2719> before <WH6440> Barak; <WH1301> and Sisera <WH5516> alighted <WH3381> from [his] chariot <WH4818> and fled <WH5127> away on foot. <WH7272>

But Barak <WH1301> pursued <WH7291> the chariots <WH7393> and the army <WH4264> as far <WH5704> as Harosheth-hagoyim, and all <WH3605> the army <WH4264> of Sisera <WH5516> fell <WH5307> by the edge <WH6310> of the sword; <WH2719> not even <WH5704> one <WH259> was left. <WH7604>

Now Sisera <WH5516> fled <WH5127> away on foot <WH7272> to the tent <WH168> of Jael <WH3278> the wife <WH802> of Heber <WH2268> the Kenite, <WH7017> for [there was] peace <WH7965> between <WH996> Jabin <WH2985> the king <WH4428> of Hazor <WH2674> and the house <WH1004> of Heber <WH2268> the Kenite. <WH7017>

And Jael <WH3278> went <WH3318> out to meet <WH7122> Sisera, <WH5516> and said <WH559> to him, "Turn <WH5493> aside, <WH5493> my master, <WH113> turn <WH5493> aside <WH5493> to me! Do not be afraid. <WH3372>" And he turned <WH5493> aside <WH5493> to her into the tent, <WH168> and she covered <WH3680> him with a rug. <WH8063>

And he said <WH559> to her, "Please <WH4994> give <WH8248> me a little <WH4592> water <WH4325> to drink, <WH8248> for I am thirsty. <WH6770>" So she opened <WH6605> a bottle <WH4997> of milk <WH2461> and gave <WH8248> him a drink; <WH8248> then she covered <WH3680> him.

And he said <WH559> to her, "Stand <WH5975> in the doorway <WH6607> of the tent, <WH168> and it shall be if <WH518> anyone <WH376> comes <WH935> and inquires <WH7592> of you, and says, <WH559> 'Is there <WH3426> anyone <WH376> here <WH6311>?' that you shall say, <WH559> 'No. <WH369>'"

But Jael, <WH3278> Heber's wife, <WH802> took <WH3947> a tent <WH168> peg <WH3489> and seized <WH7760> a hammer <WH4717> in her hand, <WH3027> and went <WH935> secretly <WH3909> to him and drove <WH8628> the peg <WH3489> into his temple, <WH7541> and it went <WH6795> through <WH6795> into the ground; <WH776> for he was sound <WH7290> asleep <WH7290> and exhausted. <WH5888> So he died. <WH4191>

And behold, <WH2009> as Barak <WH1301> pursued <WH7291> Sisera, <WH5516> Jael <WH3278> came <WH3318> out to meet <WH7122> him and said <WH559> to him, "Come, <WH1980> and I will show <WH7200> you the man <WH376> whom <WH834> you are seeking. <WH1245>" And he entered <WH935> with her, and behold <WH2009> Sisera <WH5516> was lying <WH5307> dead <WH4191> with the tent <WH3489> peg <WH3489> in his temple. <WH7541>
So God <WH430> subdued <WH3665> on that day <WH3117> Jabin <WH2985> the king <WH4428> of Canaan <WH3667> before <WH6440> the sons <WH1121> of Israel. <WH3478>

And the hand <WH3027> of the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> pressed <WH1980> heavier <WH1980> and heavier <WH7186> upon Jabin <WH2985> the king <WH4428> of Canaan, <WH3667> until <WH5704> <WH834> they had destroyed <WH3772> Jabin <WH2985> the king <WH4428> of Canaan. <WH3667>
